availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Michael Razor (Henry County tavern keeper and soldier in the 13th and 47th Kentucky Infantry)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and soldier. Kentucky native. Tavern keeper in Henry County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Henry County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Private in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 1861 to June 1863. Promoted to lieutenant in the 47th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) in June 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 70.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 869.
